reviews.text: Perfect for afternoon tea, for all students, researchers, professors and staffs. Brilliant ideas and discussion are companyed with the tea and cakes. Maybe half of the inspration, innovation, and novelty by ECE engineering account for the coffee and tea provided by them.

Their salmon mentaiko bowl was so good... But I don't think they serve it anymore. Their drinks are very sweet. I always ask for siew dai, though I once heard someone order "extra sweet"... She's built different, I guess. They don't serve iced drinks during university vacation time.. they said they don't bring in ice during the school breaks.

It is located within the Engineering campus, near to the Cheers self-service minimart.

The stall sells kopi, teh, milo, honey lemon, and some others. The kopi they serve is good.

For snacks, they have a wide variety. They have the buns (Bo Luo Bao, hot dog bun), sandwiches (egg mayo, ham), waffles, fried items (samosa, banana ball, vadai), cakes (sold by the slice), and many others. The snacks are generally quite good.

The queue may be quite busy after lunch time and or tea-break time, but the queues are generally moving quickly.

Little stand along the walkway of the Engineering building. Tried the beancurd pudding which was pretty smooth and not over sweet, with a touch of almond flavour. Service was unsmiling and matter of fact but one supposes that's too be expected.

Usually, I do not give 1 star to shop but the staff was extremely rude and dishonest. The scrambled egg sandwich is priced at $1.20 on the price tag. But the staff charged me $1.50 for it , and asked me to go away.
